Started my entrepreneurial journey with $500 and a dream. ðŸ’­
2 years later: 50+ clients, 6-figure revenue.
Sometimes you just have to take the leap! ðŸš€

Failed startup #3 just shut down. ðŸ’”
Lessons learned:
- Validate before you build
- Cash flow > Revenue
- Team > Idea

On to the next! ðŸ”„

Bootstrapped vs VC funding:
Bootstrapped: Your rules, your pace, your equity
VC: Faster growth, more pressure, shared control

Neither is wrong. Choose what aligns with your vision. ðŸŽ¯

Cold emailing works! ðŸ“§
Sent 100 emails, got 3 responses, closed 1 deal.
That 1 deal paid for 6 months of operations.
1% success rate = 100% life change

Building in public vs building in stealth:
Public: Get feedback, build audience, accountability
Stealth: Focus deeply, avoid distractions, surprise factor

I chose public. Best decision ever! ðŸ“¢

Hiring your first employee is terrifying. ðŸ˜°
Suddenly you're responsible for someone else's livelihood.
But it's also the first step toward building something bigger than yourself. ðŸŒ±

Product-market fit feels like:
âŒ Pushing a boulder uphill
âœ… Surfing a giant wave

When you find it, you'll know. Until then, keep iterating! ðŸ„â€â™‚ï¸

Raised our Series A! ðŸŽ‰
$2M to scale our AI-powered platform.
From garage startup to funded company in 18 months.
The journey has just begun! ðŸš€

Mistake I see new entrepreneurs make:
Falling in love with their solution instead of the problem.
Customers buy problem-solving, not features. ðŸŽ¯

Work-life balance as a founder is a myth. âš–ï¸
It's more like work-life integration.
Some days are 16-hour grinds, others are 4-hour walks.
Flexibility > Balance
